text: The Bear River High School Science Building, at 1450 S. Main St. in Garland, Utah, was built as a Works Progress Administration public works project in 1935. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1985. It is a two-story red brick building, PWA Moderne in style. With It was one of 233 buildings built in Utah as part of similar programs. ==References== Category:Schools in Utah Category:PWA Moderne architecture in Utah Category:National Register of Historic Places in Box Elder County, Utah Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1935
title: Bear River High School Science Building
